pullRequest.title: Fix 919issue: [transformer=FROM_EXCEL] Provide possibility to use the range of ALL cells
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #919
[transformer=FROM_EXCEL] Provide possibility to use the range of ALL cells

nodes.bodyText: the header is cells from the first row in the range
I think before using the property, you should validate that it exists
what about handling of line breaks in excel cells?

looks like the result of the following command won't be changed after multiple executions, so you can reuse it
sheetParser.getDataFromRange(range).stream().map(CellValue::getValue).collect(Collectors.toList())

can't it be like
for (int col..... = cellRangeAddress.getFirstColumn(); col..... < cellRangeAddress.getLastColumn(); col.....++)

beforeCommit.message:
Fix 919issue

[transformer=FROM_EXCEL] Provide possibility to use the range of ALL cells

afterCommit.message:
Fix 919issue

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -23,7 +23,7 @@ implementation(group: 'org.vividus', name: 'vividus-plugin-excel', version: '{pa
 
 |`column`
 |
-|the resulting column name in the generated table
+|the resulting column name in the generated table, if there is

@@ -56,6 +56,7 @@ implementation(group: 'org.vividus', name: 'vividus-plugin-excel', version: '{pa
 
 [IMPORTANT]
 `range` and `addresses` are competing parameters and only one can be specified in the transformer declaration at the same time.
+If `column` parameter is missing in properties than the first row is using for the column headings.

@@ -56,6 +56,7 @@ implementation(group: 'org.vividus', name: 'vividus-plugin-excel', version: '{pa
 
 [IMPORTANT]
 `range` and `addresses` are competing parameters and only one can be specified in the transformer declaration at the same time.
+If `column` parameter is missing in properties than the first row is using for the column headings.

nodes.bodyText: the method becomes too long and looks too complicated, consider refactoring to improve readability
format in one line or chain-like view
you shouldn't transform linear data (list) to table, you should extract data as table from excel (without extra transformation)

nodes.bodyText: Please put it under its own section
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -56,6 +56,7 @@ implementation(group: 'org.vividus', name: 'vividus-plugin-excel', version: '{pa
 
 [IMPORTANT]
 `range` and `addresses` are competing parameters and only one can be specified in the transformer declaration at the same time.
+If `column` parameter is missing in properties then the first row is used for the column headings.

nodes.bodyText: Shouldn't it be part of ExcelSheetParser?

nodes.bodyText: if you need to get data from cols with indexes like 1,5,6 they you will get row with index 1,2,3..... for each of those col indexes, so can we iterate through rows and populate cols without having to access the same rows multiple times?

please align streams in the following format
source.stream()
      .op1()
      .op2()
      .op3()
       ........
